## How to add xAPI packages as learning objects?

Experience API (xAPI) is an e-learning software specification that allows
learning content and learning systems to speak to each other in a manner that
records and tracks all types of learning experiences. xAPI allows staff to
better understand how learners are learning by tracking, evaluating, and
improving their learning experience.

If you have learning content that is published in a package and the package
meets the xAPI standard, you can be sure that it can be played in Curricula.
The learning content can be seamlessly imported to Curricula and provides more
interactive learning. In Curricula, an xAPI package can be added as a learning
object.

John is the course manager in an organisation. He receives an xAPI package and
would like to use it as the learning object in his course. Now let’s see how
John will add an xAPI package in Curricula.

1\. In Curricula, John clicks **Course** on the left navigation pane, and
finds his course.

2\. John clicks the Configure button and he can see the learning paths that he
configured.

3\. He locates a session in a learning path and clicks the learning object
type **xAPI**.

4\. John fills in the learning object information, uploads an xAPI package
from his local device, and then clicks **Save and publish**.

5\. In the **Publish learning object** panel, he completes the publish
settings for each class.

6\. When John finishes the configurations for a class, he clicks **Publish**.

If John wants to preview the content, he can click the learning object, and
then click **Preview xAPI** in the **xAPI details** panel.
